snippet: A federal judge awarded only $750,000 of the $130 million the Securities and Exchange Commission had sought from Bruce Bent II, a manager of the Reserve Primary Fund, and two Reserve entities.
abstract: Federal Judge Paul G Gardephe awards only $750,000 of the $130 million the Securities and Exchange Commission had sought from Bruce Bent II, manager of the Reserve Primary Fund, and two Reserve entities; lawsuit arose from 2008 collapse of large money market fund.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge awarded only $750,000 of the $130 million the Securities and Exchange Commission had sought from Bruce Bent II, a manager of the Reserve Primary Fund, and two Reserve entities.

headline.main: Judge Spares Money Fund Fine Sought by the S.E.C.
headline.print_headline: Judge Spares Money Fund Fine Sought By the S.E.C.
